title: Hawai'i Volcanoes National Park: Firearms
body: Firearms Information       As of February 22, 2010, a new federal law allows people who can legally possess firearms under applicable federal, state, and local laws to legally possess firearms in this park. It is the responsibility of visitors to understand and comply with all applicable state, local, and federal firearms laws before entering this park. As a starting point, visit the State of Hawai‘i's website: Hawaii Revised Statutes Title 10 Chapter 134 - Firearms, Ammunition and Dangerous Weapons Federal law also prohibits firearms in certain facilities in this park; those places are marked with signs at all public entrances. There are no firing ranges or public hunting areas in Hawai`i Volcanoes National Park.      Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) pdf 18.2k Answers to questions you may have about firearms in national parks. Note: To view pdf documents, you will need to have Adobe Reader installed on your computer.  Get your free Adobe Reader download
